{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3158424,"name":"AfterTen","username":"AfterTen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/afterten/{size}/11780_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-06T18:04:14.976Z","cooked":"

Using the WPILIBPi image but wondering if there is a way to set the zoom level of the USB cameras (LifeCam 3000) programmatically from the Pi?
Would like to be able to send a zoom level over NT and have the Pi set the zoom level.

Haven’t tried yet but it looks like the only way I potenatially see is loading a config file to the camera with a zoom level.

If this does end up being the case does the JSON have to include all the camera settings or could the one I load just have the zoom level?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2023-03-06T18:04:14.976Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":23,"reads":57,"readers_count":56,"score":126.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":429143,"topic_slug":"wpilibpi-setting-usb-camera-zoom-level-java","display_username":"AfterTen","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27113,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3572 Wavelength - Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/wpilibpi-setting-usb-camera-zoom-level-java/429143/1","custom_user_title":"3572 Wavelength - Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3158487,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-06T18:51:44.750Z","cooked":"

The builtin camera streamer doesn’t have that feature, but you can customize one of the template programs (e.g. Python, Java, or C++) to add that functionality (read a NT value and write a camera property such as zoom with that value).

Sure, that is our plan. Right now we have an OPENCV pipeline running on a Pi using the Java template and WPILIBPi.
But I didn’t see, until just now, the API call in cscore that allows me to set a property.
I though “getProperty” returned a string or something. I see now it returns a “VideoProperty” that I can then set.
I assume this is a strategy I want to use?

Yes. You can find the list of property names on the streaming webpage (it has sliders/radio buttons for each property—the property name is the label for the slider).
